New Records: Virat Kohli scored an unbeaten 103, his 48th ODI century
India successfully chased down 257 runs to win by 7 wickets
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli's unbeaten 103 was a key performance
Litton Das was dismissed by Ravindra Jadeja
Shubman Gill scored his 10th ODI fifty
Shardul Thakur and Kuldeep Yadav contributed with wickets
Pre-Game Insights: Bangladesh won the toss and elected to bat first
India had a 3-1 record against Bangladesh in World Cups
Bangladesh had won three of their last four matches against India
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli refused to call it an upset
India extended their winning streak to four
Bangladesh's performance was commendable despite the loss
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was high-scoring with 261 runs in 42 overs
The match was part of India's strong World Cup performance
Others: Historical context of India vs Bangladesh in World Cups
Impact of Virat Kohli's performance on team morale
